qwerty-latin.name: QWERTY Latin
lessons: Free software is a matter of liberty, not price.
Think of \u2018free\u2019 as in \u2018free speech\u2019, not as in \u2018free beer\u2019.
Free software gives users the freedom to study, change and share the software.
If a programme is proprietary, its users are at the mercy of its publisher.
Users should be in control of their computing, not controlled by software publishers.
Sharing improves software; secrecy harms users and society.
I would like to see every programme in the world be free software.
When software isn\u2019t free, it creates social problems, not merely technical ones.
The goal of free software is to give users freedom and control over their computing.
We must reject models of computing that treat users as adversaries.
Technology must serve people\u2019s freedom, not their enslavement to corporations.
